subject: Re: Non-static inner classes of test classes using enclosing fixtures?
msgSnippet: Hi David, This looks promising -- I ll experiment further and report my findings.  Thanks! --p
messageBody:
Hi David,

This looks promising -- I'll experiment further and report my findings. Thanks!

--p

--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, David Saff <david@...> wrote:
>
> Paul,
>
> Have you looked at Theory support in JUnit > 4.4? It may not give you
> everything you want, but I'd be curious to know how close it gets.
> Thanks,
>
> David
>
> On Sat, May 9, 2009 at 1:37 PM, Paul Holser <pholser@...> wrote:
> > Hello JUnit,
> >
> > I have some abstract classes that enable a caller to check that classes which expose collection fields via accessor methods do so via the java.util.Collections#unmodifiable___() facilities. Â Here are some snippets:
